headline: The Parable of the Lake
description: A meditation on death, faith, and existence told through the image of ripples spreading across a vast lake. The piece reflects on how one life, one death, shapes the whole through unseen reverberations of God’s order.
author: Aleksandr
whyItMatters: This parable distills the mystery of death and its continuing effects into a simple, cosmic metaphor. It links personal loss with divine order, offering a way to hold grief within the frame of eternity.

motifMap.meaning: Vastness of existence, surface of life and death
Consequences of one life, one death, spreading through time and others
Singular act of death, or event, that reshapes the entire order
Cosmic order mirrored in earthly reflection

articleExcerpt: Imagine standing at the edge of a vast, placid lake, 1000 miles across, smooth and undisturbed. Now imagine throwing a stone into it. How far does that ripple travel? … Personally, my father’s death when I was 19 was, at the time, unimaginable. I would give almost anything to have him back or to speak with him again. Yet his death propelled me forward in life in ways nothing else had.
